title: Earth, Air, Fire, Water: The Foundation of Alchemical Thought
topicDescription: The classical four elements as the basis of all matter
keyPoints: All matter composed of combinations of four elements
Hot and dry = Fire, Cold and wet = Water
How to identify dominant elements in substances
Why this theory is wrong but still useful

title: Breaking Things Down: The Art of Dissolution
topicDescription: How to break down substances into their component parts using solvents
keyPoints: Water dissolves salts and sugars
Alcohol dissolves oils and resins
Acids dissolve metals and minerals
The principle of 'like dissolves like'

title: Separating the Pure from the Impure: The Art of Distillation
topicDescription: Using heat to separate substances by boiling point
keyPoints: The alembic: vessel, condensing tube, and collection flask
Water boils at 100°C, alcohol at 78°C
Why you can't distill wine into pure alcohol
Common explosions and how to avoid them

title: Reduction by Fire: The Process of Calcination
topicDescription: Heating substances to dryness to remove volatile components
keyPoints: Burning away impurities leaves purified ash
Temperature control is critical
Metals produce colorful oxides when calcined
The calx of lead becomes litharge (yellow) or minium (red)

title: The Tria Prima: Mercury, Sulfur, and Salt as Universal Principles
topicDescription: The three fundamental principles that govern alchemical transformation
keyPoints: Mercury = fluidity, volatility, spirit
Sulfur = combustibility, soul, activity
Salt = fixity, body, materiality
All substances contain varying proportions of these principles
